intro: Eusteralis auricularia, commonly known as the auricular bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its flowers are bell-shaped with blue or violet petals. Eusteralis auricularia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
